intro: Ageratina costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has small, white or pale blue flowers. Its leaves are usually opposite and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ageratina costaricensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid climates.
